p: The essential oil showed a weak inhibitory activity against Enterococcus faecalis and Staphylococcus aureus, while acorenone B was non-active at the maximum dose tested (10 mg/mL) ( Table 3). According to Holetz et al. [ 36], an antibacterial activity is considered good when the Minimal Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) value is less than 100 Î¼g/mL, demonstrating that both the essential oil and acorenone B do not show inhibitory activity against the evaluated strains.
